subject: Investing
title: The Sentiment Cycle
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Sentiment Cycle.

hook.text: Investor sentiment goes: optimism, excitement, euphoria, anxiety, denial, panic, depression, hopeâ€”then repeats.

buildup.text: Each stage of the sentiment cycle maps to a predictable set of investor behaviors and market moves.

discovery.text: Peak euphoria coincides with market tops. Maximum depression coincides with market bottoms.

twist.text: You can't feel which stage you're in. Euphoria feels like justified confidence; depression feels like realism.

climax.text: Survey data, fund flows, and margin debt levels can pinpoint where the cycle stands more objectively.

punchline.text: Emotions travel in circles. Your strategy shouldn't.

quiz.question: What emotion typically coincides with market tops?
